title: Mother 'lost, broken, disgusted and hurt' as she discovers husband is having affair with her daughter
text:

A mother-of-three has pleaded for help after her husband and one of her adult daughters have continued a sexual affair for more than a year. 
The woman has reportedly revealed her problem after originally finding out about the affair involving her daughter - from another marriage - in December 2015. 
The woman, identified as Anonymous to conceal her identity, wrote to women's website Ravish asking for advice. 
“I have been stuck in this nightmare for a year and I can’t take another day," she told the website . The woman feels she is unable to leave her husband because she is financially dependent on him (stock photo) (Photo: Digital Vision) Read More 
After eight years of marriage, the couple had three children, though her two adult girls were to a different man. 
She was, she said, financially dependent on her husband. 
“I found out in December 2015 that my oldest daughter and my husband were messing around behind my back. 
She confronted them but their response was "all lies". 
And she's seen text messages they've sent each other, talking about how much they love each other. 
The feelings were also revealed in "love cards" they had sent each other. 
“They won’t stop and I’m completely depressed, lost, broken, disgusted, and hurt," the mum said. 
“We don’t have sex or anything anymore either!" 
Advice columnist Erin Khar advised the woman to put her sanity ahead of her financial security. Read More 
"First, make an appointment with a therapist and make an appointment with a lawyer. Next, get your personal and financial affairs in order,” she wrote. 
"Organise your finances, keep a record of everything that has transpired." 
Expert psychologist, Melissa Keogh told News.com.au family affairs were often "highly dysfunctional" and needed mental health treatment. 
“There are generally longstanding, deep-seated issues at play and most often, for healthy boundaries and functional family dynamics to be re-established, all family members need to be in receipt of significant psychological assistance,” she told the website. Like us on Facebook
